resources.string: Each player starts out with 5 chalk lines. Winning a round means you can either swipe away 1, 2 or 3 of your lines depending on what combination you rolled. The first to clear all of his lines wins the game.

The first player throws the dices. He has a maximum of 3 chances every round. He can stop at any time by passing and giving player 2 his turn. That however means player 1 has set the maximum throws for this round. Player 2 always has as much throws as player 1 used in that round but he can pass his turn too if he throws a desired outcome that makes him win already.
When both players have thrown, the round winner is determined through the following combinations (from highest score to lowest):
Zand: 3x same value (555 is better than 444, etc)
When a tie happens, the round has to be replayed. In All other cases there is a winner and he can swipe:
2 lines when winning with "Zand" (3x same value)
* = HOWEVER when 5 lines left this results in an INSTANT win for the other player!
SPECIAL: a "Zeven" (2-2-3) means all players get +1 on their lines.
